FULL TITLE : APPEALED TO THE PHILIPPINE SPORTS COMMISSION (PSC) TO CONSIDER THE INCLUSION OF SURFING AS A "FOCUS SPORT" AND AS ONE OF THE PRIORITIES FOR ITS GRASSROOTS PROGRAM FOR DEVELOPMENT
SHORT TITLE : Siargao Islands As The Surfing Capital Of The Philippines
ABSTRACT : Rep. Matugas initially discussed the sport of surfing and its popularity in the island of Siargao which became internationally known as the surfing capital of the Philippines and ranked by many local and international surfers as the best surfing spot in the world. In this regard, he then informed the Body that the island of Siargao would be hosting the 22nd International Surfing Competitions which would determine the qualifiers for the World Surf League world tour. As the International Olympic Committee had announced that surfing would be included in the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan, Rep. Matugas expressed belief that surfing would be the sport where the Philippines can excel and finally earn an Olympic gold medal. As such, he enjoined his colleagues to support the Filipino surfers so they could do well in the qualifying rounds leading to the 2020 Tokyo Olympic and appealed to the Philippine Sports Commission (PSC) to consider the inclusion of surfing as a “focus sport” and as one of the priorities for its grassroots program for development....(SOURCE: House Journal No.23,p.15)
